intro: Sinapis nudicaulis, commonly known as the slender mustard, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring small, bright yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Sinapis nudicaulis is known for its rapid growth and is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields.
